abstract: Two tribes are arguing in Federal District Court in Manhattan that New York’s top financial regulator overstepped his jurisdictional bounds in his efforts to end their online lending operations in the state.
snippet: Two tribes are arguing in Federal District Court in Manhattan that New York’s top financial regulator overstepped his jurisdictional bounds in his efforts to end their online lending operations in the state.
lead_paragraph: Updated, 8:46 p.m. | Since becoming New York State’s top financial regulator in 2011, Benjamin M. Lawsky has aggressively pursued wrongdoing far beyond the state’s borders, investigating financial consultants in Washington, insurance industry practices nationwide and money laundering overseas.

headline.main: Tribes Challenge New York’s Authority Over Their Lending
headline.print_headline: Tribes Challenge New York’s Authority Over Their Lending

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
